unit_learning_outcomes.description: Develop strategies supporting the initiation, maintenance and progression of relationships with customers
Critique the operationalisation and use of CRM strategies in diverse contexts
Justify firms' use of CRM technologies and systems and recommend best-practice approaches

enrolment_rules.description: BUS651 or MGMT6051 or MKTG696 or MKTG6096 or BUS827 or MGMT8027

assessments.description:
The 4000 word report will be assessed on individual student responses to a set of tasks evaluating and critiquing the implementation of CRM technologies and systems within organisations.

More information about each components will be provided on iLearn.                                                                                                                 The report should be submitted via Turnitin.

The task involves students applying knowledge of  CRM-related behavioural theories and CRM principles discussed in the classroom to develop strategies related to Customer Value Propositions (CVP's) and customer experiences/journey.  Students are required to utilise two or three of theories discussed in the classrom to examine and analyse, one brand/organisation,  the overall CVP, the CVP's for different consumer segments and differences in customer experiences/journeys across relevant customer segments. The findings from the above analysis are to be presented in either a multi-media (video/animation) or powerpoint presentation to be submitted via Turnitin. Students will be able to choose the one brand/organisation they examine from a list of candidate organisations provided.
Length: 8 - 10 slides (PowerPoint) /5-6 minute (Video)

Four case studies will be provided to students before class in nominated weeks. Associated with each case study there will be 3-4 short answer questions in a separate document made available on i-learn. The case studies and the associated case study questions will be discussed in the class as a part of class activities in the nominated weeks. Students will be assessed on their oral contribution to each of the four case study class discussions. The total mark for this assessment component will consist of the student's best three marks out of the four case study discussions in class. 
However, to obtain a mark for each case study class discussion, students must be present in that class and must submit a document with typed responses to the case study questions (200 words in total) on Turnitin before the commencement of the class.

data.description: The increasingly globalised and competitive market environment, together with technological disruption, has led to a shift of market power from organisations to customers. Maintaining profit and market share in this environment has necessitated organisations adopting strategies that place greater emphasis on customers and developing relationships with them. In this unit, students will apply knowledge to develop strategies supporting the initiation, maintenance and progression of relationships with customers. Further, students will learn to compare and contrast potential CRM strategies available to organisations operating in diverse contexts. Students will also learn to critically analyse organisations' CRM technologies and systems and provide suggestions for improvements.
data.title: Managing Customer Relationships
